posts.text: [TOC] Source Link: https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1u7rkBTE1H/?spm_id_from=333.1365.list.card_archive.click&vd_source=deb925e1ef7917ab06616c5c828bb362 a bunch of thoughts and feeling that had been bubbling below the surface came to the surface. 这里bubble是汇聚，积累的意思 epiphany n 顿悟 irresponsibility n 不负责任 tame a 驯服的，平淡的 这里明显说自己生活太无聊了，太平淡了 Tamed Beefalo is pretty tame. Beefalo look peaceful, but they can be dangerous. I can’t tell you the late time I went to a club, okay? 这个I can’t tell you… 可理解为我不知道具体；也可以理解为我知道但不方便透露。 be striving to do 努力做某事 I feel like a lot of young people actually are striving to live a life like this. I found myself feeling really bored… under-stimulated 缺乏刺激的 expedite v 加速 restlessness 不安定 a sense of restlessness 不安定感 -esque -式的 grandmother-esque 老奶奶式的 pop a Zyn/Zin 嘬一口烟 来一口尼古丁袋 sobriety n 节制，戒酒解毒，保持清醒 I developed an allergy 这里develop表示产生，以前没有，现在出现了，或者慢慢出现 hives n 荨麻疹 rashes 皮疹 nausea n 恶心 miserable a 痛苦的，悲惨的 sluggish a 迟缓的，懒洋洋的 bummer n 失望，扫兴

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p5s3rBGgCx8 [TOC] smileuniversal a 普遍的 注意发音 as we go along 我们继续的过程 1we will find out as we go along be planning on doing 1I wasn't planning on doing all the facial expressions myself, but I am smiling. frowndissatisfaction n 不满 you are disappointed, you are not satisfied. 1When you are satisfied or when you express satisfaction, you're happy with something. scowl v.n 怒视 小狗不许瞪人mimic v 模仿 mop it up 拿墩布擦 annoyance n 烦恼，气恼 grimace v.n 怪相，苦相 痛苦相，疼的倒吸一口凉气，愁眉苦脸stubbed your toe 踢到脚趾头 stub n 存根，烟蒂，树桩 v 连根拔起，踢到，踩灭 twist your ankle 崴脚，扭伤脚踝 in response to 。。的回应 1It's in response to being injured. jammed my fingers 卡住我的手指 理解为夹住卡住都可以 1When the volleyball jammmed my fingers, I grimaced when that happened. grin v.n 咧嘴笑He was grinning from ear to ear. content n 满足 12Bob 用了contentness n 满足 但是这个词实际上是不存在的 content n 满足You are very content and happy. 这里又用了 content的adj 满足的 disgust v.n 反感，厌恶funny a 又故障的，可疑的 1If food has gone bad and smells funny. 闻起来很怪 intoxicated 12see someone who's intoxicated在日常描述中说的是一个人got drunk 喝酒喝多了， high这个词表示吸毒吸high了，在药店里的intoxicated 才表示某物中毒 "intoxicated" in a medical or scientific context, especially when referring to substances, it could imply poisoning or exposure to toxic substances. surpriseunexpectedly adv 意外地，出乎意料地 anger like scowlbe mad at someone scrunch v 碾压 you kind of scrunch your forehead together. annoyed a 恼火的 sadness n 悲伤，悲痛look of concern 想东西的样子 fear1If someone jumped out from behind of a wall at night and said boo and tried to scare me, by the way, it was Halloween last night. I better lput my hands up to defend myself. wide open 张开的很大 your eyes really wide open be afraid of doing/something 害怕做/某事 you would be ready to run away smirk v 得意的笑，幸灾乐祸的笑 n 傻笑，得意的笑arrogance n 傲慢，自大 passive a 被动的 sense 感觉，意义 in that sense 从这个感觉上来说，从这个意义上来说 more of 更像是 it’s more of a positive thing. 这更是一件积极的事情。 12He has a smirk on his face.He is smirking. sneer v.n 冷笑，嘲笑，讥讽It’s signal of aggression. be insulted and give an insult back annoyance n 气恼，恼火 wince v.n 畏缩1I know the last time I winced was because a bee was flying at my head and then it didn't turn. violence scene 暴力场面 break up 分手，这里是分开二人 You tried to break up the fight. You tried to break up your two friends who are fighting with each other. look away 移开目光 stare v.n 凝视，盯着12You stare at someone, you look at them intently. intently adv 专心地and to hardly blink and to not look away either. eye roll n 翻白眼 roll your eyes v corny a 粗鄙的，陈词滥调的 wink v.n 眨眼示意，你懂的inappropriate a 不恰当的，不合适的 1If you see someone or meet some who you are compatible with。。。 这里的compatible是相匹配的 puppy dog eyes 天真幼稚的表情，可怜巴巴的眼神squint v.n 眯眼看，斜视1your eyes are used to the dark, and then your eyes are used to the dark, you are like it's really bright. glare v.n 怒视 very similar to stareintense a 激烈的，严肃的 beam n.v 喜笑颜开，心花怒放，笑逐颜开People beam with joy. a split second 一瞬间 pout v 撅嘴，闷闷不乐1Kids often pout when they don't get what they want. stick out 伸出 you stick out your bottom lip 你撅起你的下嘴唇 raise your eyebrows 挑眉毛，扬起眉毛1We sometimes raise our eyebrows when we're suprised. We kind of don't agree with someone. I beg to differ 我不敢苟同 延边刺客用语，这个观点我不敢苟同 a dirty look 鄙夷的眼神，就是瞪人confusedUtilities & Serviceshttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pFqcWdkktpU 12a service that is used by the public, such as an electricity or gas supply:The biggest financial worries are mortgages followed by utility bills. utility n 公共服务/公共供给 utility billelectrical bill, gas bill, internet bill pricey a 价格昂贵的 Anyways, utility bills, it’s basically piece of paper with your name and address and the date and an amount of money that you owe for that utility. electricity/powerhydro == hydroelectric 水电 加拿大部分地区叫法 The lights went out. 用go out这个词组形容蜡烛或者灯光突然熄灭 interchangeably adv 可交换地 1Having your garbage picked up is considered more of a service. 这里的having something Ved是让某物被如何 == 让垃圾被收走 keep that in mind 牢记这个 electrical panel 电气面板，配电箱，咱们一般叫电箱子，电表箱子 circuit breaker 电路断路器 就是短路或过载会跳闸那玩意，这个词挺重要的，在网络架构中有这个服务防止访问过载 fuses n 保险丝 二极管一样的东西，烧断了需要换新的，现在应该都不用了 1This is where your electricity comes into your house or apartment. trip v 表示跳闸，断路 1If it wasn't me turning it of, it might have been a breaker tripping in the basement. phonephone plane old-fashioned 老式的，陈旧样式的 old fashioned phone 他指代的是座机 waterpotable water 饮用水drinking water; potable a 可饮用的 portable a 便携的 jug 桶，罐 blue jug 饮用水的塑料桶 sitting by me 可以指代一个人或者物体在我身边 I don’t have one sitting by me running watercabin 小屋，船舱，客舱 water treatment plant 水处理工厂 disinfect v 消毒，杀菌 sanitize v 消毒 sewer 下水道sewer fee 理解为污水处理费 So if you use a certain number of liters of water per month, you’re charged for the water. drain n 排水 sewer说的是下水道系统，与污水处理，城市facility有关 drain特指下水管道，排水管，排水口，水再流向哪里就不管了 wastewater treatment plant 污水处理工厂sewage n 污水，污物 1waste matter such as water or human urine or solid waste. 固体垃圾说的已经很委婉了 natural gas 天然气propane n 丙烷 another burnable gas Our house is heated with propane. 牛排店外边见过这种烧天然气的取暖设备 furnace n 火炉 heatcable TV satellite TVhook up 搭上线，认识，发展关系 反正有点勾搭上的意思，指代电视连上线 antenna n 天线，触须 live out in the country. 其实他说live in就行，这里的out强调离市中心远 satellite dish 卫星天线大锅 from a satellite up in orbit here. 就是觉得这介词用的很口语 从在轨道上运行的卫星上 routerwirelessly adv 无线地 bundle 捆绑销售（买同一个公司的多个服务会给一定的discount）combo 麦当劳叫combo套餐，买网络叫bundle security systemgo off 发出特定的声音，爆炸声，离开，变质 这里他说的是报警 1A security system can be as simple as if someone open the door, an alarm goes off, but it might also be monitored. medical alert systempendant 吊坠 garbage/trash/recyclingthrow out 扔掉 12you might have to pay a separate bill.你可能需要付一笔单独的账单 expense n 花销 v 收费 pile up 堆积 snow removalshovel n.v 铲子 铲 plow n.v 犁地，铲雪 water line/water main 水管 main n 总管道 interchangeably 他又用到这个词 咱们就理解为 “换着用” sewer line/main 同理下水总管道 manhole 检查井 咱们中文老说下水道，井盖，其实这个水电网都有 utility pole 电线杆 hydro pole backup generator 备用发电机 goes out 他又用到这个，说电力停电的时候 run off 以。。为动力 run off natural gas or gasoline off-grid 脱离网络(自己供给电力) 相对我们普通人on grid 1that you must make your own electricity

posts.title: Harry Potter
posts.text: The Boy Who LivedChapter 1 The Boy Who LivedPrivet n 女贞，或者叫水蜡树 <就是那种非常常见的用做hedge的bush> 1Privet (Ligustrum species) is indeed a normal, well-known plant, often used as a hedge in landscaping. mysterious a 神秘的 <这个单词发音总忘> hold with 支持某观点 hold with the idea. 这个词总用于否定，不赞成 1234567891011I don’t hold with wasting time on things that don’t matter.我不赞同把时间浪费在不重要的事情上。She doesn’t hold with people being rude to each other.她不赞同人们彼此无礼的行为。They don’t hold with the idea of working on weekends.他们不赞成周末工作。My parents never held with letting children stay up late.我父母一直不赞成让孩子熬夜。 hold the view/belief/opinion that… 表示某人持有某观点 1234567891011121314I hold the view that remote work can increase productivity for some employees.（我认为远程工作可以提高某些员工的生产力。）Many people hold the belief that technology will continue to shape the future of our industry.（许多人认为科技会继续塑造我们行业的未来。）I hold the opinion that teamwork is essential for success in most projects.（我认为团队合作对大多数项目的成功至关重要。）Our team holds the position that open communication leads to better project outcomes.（我们团队认为开放沟通可以带来更好的项目结果。）Some hold a different perspective, but I hold that diversity in ideas leads to innovation.（有些人持不同的观点，但我认为多样化的想法能够带来创新。） beefy a 身材很zhuang三声的人 == 可以表示胖，也可以表示强壮 with hardly any neck 几乎没脖子 mustache a 八字胡 had nearly twice the usual amount of neck 倍数表达 came in very useful 非常有用 come in 理解为派上用场 crane n 升降机，鹤 v 伸长脖子看 crane over 伸长脖子越过 shudder v 打寒颤 mix with somebody 跟某人鬼混在一起，与HP有来往 12345这里的want后面没用to，直接接了doing，表示某事持续、延续发生、某种状态。They didn't want Dudley mixing with a child like that.“want somebody doing something”：表示不希望某人处于某种状态、进行某项活动，带有一种对该状态的抵触或反感。“want somebody to do something”：更中性，通常表示希望某人完成某个具体的动作或任务。 wrestle v.n 摔跤，扭打 这里形容费力地把挣扎的 Dudley 放到他的高脚椅上。 tawny a 茶色的，褐色的 flutter v.n 振翅，拍打翅膀 peck v.n 轻啄 这里说的是轻轻的亲吻一下 tantrum n 发火，闹情绪 1234a sudden period of uncontrolled anger like a young child's:Charlie had/threw a tantrum in the shop because I wouldn't buy him any sweets.If she doesn't get her own way she has temper tantrums. little tyke 臭小子 chortle v == laugh backed out of … drive 退出车道 peculiar a unusual and strange, sometimes in an unpleasant way jerk v If you jerk something or someone in a particular direction, or they jerk in a particular direction, they move a short distance very suddenly and quickly. tabby cat 虎斑猫 tabby a 有斑纹的 in sight 视野内 put the cat out of his mind 不想猫的事情了，将猫咪的事情抛到脑后 drive out 驱逐，迫使离开 couldn’t help doing == can’t help doing 忍不住做 cloak n 长斗篷 cape n 披风，短斗篷 getups n 装扮，扮相 weirdo n 奇怪的人 drummed v 敲击 drum steering wheel 方向盘 a huddle of 一群人，一大帮子人 close by 在附近 1He drummed his fingers on the steering wheel and his eyes fell on a huddle of these weirdos standing quite close by. enrage v 使激怒 be enraged 被激怒 emerald 翠绿色 The nerve of him! 岂有此理，他真实胆肥了嘿！ stunt n 噱头，作秀 swoop v 猛冲 open-mouthed 目瞪口呆地，惊掉下巴地 owl after owl 这是指一直猫头鹰接着另一只猫头鹰 stretch his legs 伸伸腿 clutch v 抓着 dead adv 突然 Mr. Dursley stopped dead. but thought better of it.但还是打消了这个念头 12He was about to say something, but thought better of it.他本来想说些什么，但还是打消了念头。 snap at 严厉斥责，追着咬 Come to think of it 表示刚想起来 == 这么说来，这么一琢磨 no point in doing 没意义做某事 There was no point in worrying Mrs. Dursley grunt v 嘟哝 stumble v 绊倒 violet a.n 紫罗兰，紫罗兰的 squeaky a 吱吱嘎嘎作响的 passersby n 过路人 rejoice v 很高兴 stand rooted to the spot 站在原地不动 rattled a 担忧的 set off 动身，出发，启程 set off for home 动身回家 approve of 赞成，支持 12He didn’t approve of imagination.老姨夫对想象力持否定态度 pull into 驶入 backed out of 倒车倒出 spot 这个词 v 看见，使有斑点 a 有斑点的==同spotted stern a 严厉的，不动摇的，严峻的 newscaster n 新闻播报员 over to 切换到，转向到 下面我们把镜头切换到天气预报员 as far apart as 远至。。 downpour of shooting stars 流星雨 bonfire 篝火 wet night 雨夜 whisper n 传闻，谣言 petunia 牵牛花 虽然是姨妈的名字，但是本意是牵牛花 pretend v 假装 这个单词的发音总错 mumble v 含糊的说话 大理石是哪个单词 marble snap v 厉声说 sip v 抿一口 purse v 撅嘴 n 女士钱包 stiffly adv 生硬地，顽固地 I quite agree 表示我完全赞同 crept v 匍匐爬行 creep的过去式 peer v 凝视（这个凝视就是使劲盯着瞪眼看，生怕看不见看不清） n 同辈 as though 就好像，就是像 get out 泄露，走漏；逃脱 drift v 漂流，飘移；不自觉地陷入 still a 静止的 twitch v 抽搐，抽动 narrow v 收缩，变窄 这里说猫猫眯起眼睛 you’d have thought 这个理解为 “你还以为。。。” judging by 从。。来判断 tuck v 塞入 n 衣服褶子 robe n 长袍 bathrobe 浴袍 spectacles n 眼镜；壮观的场面、表演 crooked a 弯曲的，狡诈的 老友记Phoebe用过这个词 rummag v 翻查，搜出 chuckle v 咯咯笑 mutter v 嘟哝，低声说话 flick v 轻弹，轻拂 flicker v 闪烁，摇曳 pinprick n 针刺，针孔，小的东西 beady-eyed 目光锐利的 pavement n 人行道 emerald n 翡翠 a 翠绿色的 ruffle v 弄褶皱 ruffled a 气恼的 sniff v 吸气 impatiently adv 不耐烦地 Flocks of owls 成群的猫头鹰 be bound to 一定会 sense n 理智，良好的判断 irritably adv 性急地 downright a.adv 十足的，彻头彻尾的 in broad daylight 光天化日之下 swapping rumors 交换（散布）谣言 I’m rather fond of 我相当喜欢 sensible a 理智的 flinch v 因恐惧退缩 unstick v 使脱落 get confused/confusing 感到混乱/使别人感到混乱 exasperate v 使恼怒，恶化，加剧 flatter v 奉承，讨好 blushed a 脸红的 earmuffs n 耳套，护耳 我竟然一直不知道这东西中文名字是什么 shot a sharp look at 这个动词 给了一个锐利的眼神 The owls are nothing next to the rumors 站在谣言身边，猫头鹰不算什么 == 猫头鹰相对于谣言根本不值一提 12for neither as a cat nor as a woman had she fixed Dumbledore with such a piercing stare as she did now. 这句话是倒装句 had she fixed... gasp v 倒抽一口凉气 bowed his head 低头也用这个bow reached out and patted her on the shoulder 伸出手拍人的肩膀的表达 tremble v 颤抖 faltered a 蹒跚的，犹豫的 astounding a 令人震惊的 handkerchief n 手帕，丝巾，围巾 dabbed 轻触，轻拍，轻擦 原型 dab sniff 吸，嗅 of all places 偏偏在这个地方 faintly adv 模糊地，虚弱地 rumbling a.n.v 轰隆隆 astride adv 分开双腿胯 bushy a 浓茂的 muscular a 强壮的，肌肉的 tuft 丛，一簇 a bolt of lightning 一道闪电 come in handy 派上用场 get this over with 尽快做完 shaggy a 蓬松的 whiskery 有胡须的 howl 嚎叫 sobbed a 啜泣的 get a grip on yourself 控制自己的行为或情绪 gingerly adv 小心翼翼地 a 谨慎的，轻手轻脚的 ginger n 生姜 tuck v 掖进去，塞进去 bundle n 捆，婴儿 twinkling n 瞬间 a 闪烁的 muffled a 沉闷的，压抑的，听不清的 streaming eyes 泪汪汪的眼镜 rose into == rise into 上升，升入 slinking a 鬼鬼祟祟的 swish 鞭打声，啪 prod v.n 戳

[TOC] S02E01what’s happened so far. 一直奇怪为什么用’s 原来是has的意思表示目前已经发生的状况 since forever 自古以来，一直都是 get in the way 妨碍 Something kind of got in the way let it slip that 说漏了嘴 enough about me 别管我了 Orient n 东方 baggage claim 领行李处 go for it 大胆争取 cramp n 抽筋 v 阻止 slowpoke n 慢性子 give away 泄露 cab n 出租车 since then 从那以后 crotch n 裤裆 what happened to you? pants”（爱卖弄聪明的人）和“fancy pants”（装腔作势的人）这样的词组也是类似的用法。“Cranky pants” 通常用来形容一个容易发脾气、烦躁或情绪不好的家伙。使用“pants”能让表达听起来更加轻松、幽默，给人一种调侃的感觉，而不是过于严肃或批评。 unemployed a 失业的 key lime 佛州一种青柠檬，以地名Keys命名 I’m allergic to kiwi pants and a lot of dry humping.

posts.title: Leetcode75
posts.text: [TOC] https://leetcode.com/discuss/general-discussion/460599/blind-75-leetcode-questions Binary 和 Dynamic Programming不用看 关于循环的描述 1I am looping through this array using a for loop, and each time, I print the value of the element. 常用方法汇总 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061626364656667686970map.containsKey(key)map.putmap.getmap.getOrDefault(Object key, V defaultValue);创建一个带参数的map：public static HashMap<Character, Character> map = new HashMap(){{put('(', ')');put('[',']');put('{','}');}};map.keySet()map.values()Set<String> keySet = hashMap.keySet(); Set<Map.Entry<String, String>> entrySet = hashMap.entrySet(); for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : entrySet) { System.out.println(entry.getKey() + "-" + entry.getValue()); }set.contains(value) 查看是否有值其中一种写法可以返回add的值，判断是否containsif (!set.add(x)) { return true;}字符串字符串返回特定index上的字符是str.charAt(index)或者先把字符串打成数组：str.toCharArray()s.substring(l, r); // r不包括 广度优先 queueQueue<Integer> queue = new LinkedList<Integer>();queue.addqueue.offer(i);queue.removeint u = queue.poll();PriorityQueue<Status> queue = new PriorityQueue<Status>();PriorityQueue<int[]> queue = new PriorityQueue<int[]>(new Comparator<int[]>() { public int compare(int[] m, int[] n) { return m[1] - n[1]; }});Deque<ListNode> stack = new LinkedList<ListNode>();// 数组Arrays.fill(dp, amount+1); db[0]=0char[] charArray = s.toCharArray();int[][] arr = list.toArray(new int[list.size()][]); list转数组LinkedList<Character> stack = new LinkedList();stack.offer('?'); stack.addLast(c); 注意对于栈这两个不是标准方法stack.push(c);stack.size();char temp = stack.pop(); stack.removeLast();List 转数组int[] intArray = myList.stream().mapToInt(Integer::intValue).toArray();Integer[] integerArray = list.toArray(new Integer[0]);System.out.println(Arrays.toString(integerArray));ArrayList泛型 List<List<Integer>> ret = new ArrayList<List<Integer>>();对字符的判断Character.isLetterOrDigit(s.charAt(left))sgood.append(Character.toLowerCase(ch));StringBuffer sgood_rev = new StringBuffer(sgood).reverse();compareArrays.sort(intervals, (v1, v2) -> v1[0] - v2[0]);Arrays.sort(intervals, new Comparator<int[]>(){ public int compare(int[] interval1, int[] interval2){ return interval1[0] - interval2[0]; }}); Array 101.Two Sum12345Map泛型必须用类Integer，不能是int这种基本类型map.containsKey(key)map.putmap.get存储的是以当前元素为key，寻找的是target-当前元素的值为key en note 123456789101112131415161718It might be tempting to say 可能禁不住会说add up 加起来add up to five 加起来等于5表示一个[1，4]数组可以说It is an array of 1, 4.time and space complexityend up 最后是I'll see that the time ends up being O ...n squared n的二次方，注意是edlook in v 查找，顺便看看stumble upon 碰上，遇到keep track of.. 追踪，密切关注，记录 这里是记录已经看过的数据later on 随后doesn't look like it does. 看着不像subtract v 减去 If I subtract 3 from my 1, we'll get negative 2.It doesn't matter the order. 顺序不重要，It doesn't matter 后面可以直接加it指代的名词Because I iterate once through the array. 遍历了一遍数组start out by doing 首先从doing出发/开始 code 123456789101112public int[] twoSum(int[] nums, int target) { Map<Integer, Integer> map = new HashMap(); for(int i=0; i<nums.length; i++){ int key = target - nums[i]; if(map.containsKey(key)){ return new int[]{i, map.get(key)}; }else{ map.put(nums[i], i); } } return new int[]{-1, -1};} 121.Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock1234初始的最小金额可以设置成Integer.MAX_VALUE也可以先检查数组长度，如果长度大于0，就将第一个值赋值给记录最小值的变量iterate through the array 形容便利一个数组的时候 code 这个题还是非常简单的 1234567891011121314class Solution { public int maxProfit(int[] prices) { int result = 0; int buy = prices[0]; for (int i=1; i<prices.length; i++) { if(prices[i] - buy > result){ result = prices[i] - buy; } else if (prices[i] < buy){ buy = prices[i]; } } return result; }} 217.Contains Duplicate123456distinctset.contains(value) 查看是否有值其中一种写法可以返回add的值，判断是否containsif (!set.add(x)) { return true;} code 1234567891011class Solution { public boolean containsDuplicate(int[] nums) { Set<Integer> set = new HashSet<>(); for(int i:nums){ if(!set.add(i)){ return true; } } return false; }} 238.Product of Array Except Self 成积前缀后缀乘积，空间复杂度控制n，需要背下来，开始根本记不住，现在完全能盲写 1234567891011121314public int[] productExceptSelf(int[] nums) { int len = nums.length; int[] answer = new int[len]; answer[0] = 1; for(int i=1; i<len; i++){ answer[i]=answer[i-1] * nums[i-1]; } int r = 1; for(int i=len-1; i>=0; i--){ answer[i] = answer[i] * r; r *= nums[i]; } return answer;} en note 12prefix n 前缀suffix n 后缀 code 要点是dp当前的值是给下一轮结果用的 12345678910111213141516171819class Solution { public int[] productExceptSelf(int[] nums) { int len = nums.length; if(len == 0){ return new int[]{}; } int[] result = new int[len]; Arrays.fill(result, 1); int prefix = 1; int suffix = 1; for(int i=0; i<len; i++){ result[i] *= prefix; result[len-i-1] *= suffix; prefix *= nums[i]; suffix *= nums[len-1-i]; } return result; }} example 12345678[1,2,3,4][1,1,1,1]For pre = 1, suf = 1;[1,1,1,1] pre = 1, suf = 4;[1,1,4,1] pre = 2, suf = 12;[1,12,8,1] pre = 6, suf = 24;[24,12,8,6] pre = 24, suf = 24; 53.Maximum Subarray用动态规划解题dynamic programing，有点像计算前序和，后续和 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031 public int maxSubArray(int[] nums) { int len = nums.length; int[] dp = new int[len]; dp[0] = nums[0]; int result = dp[0]; for(int i=1; i<len; i++){ if(dp[i-1] < 0){ dp[i] = nums[i]; } else{ dp[i] = dp[i-1] + nums[i]; } result=result<dp[i]?dp[i]:result; } return result; }// 改进：只需要记录当前sum就可以了// 用sum记录前序和，当前序和小于0，就用当前值做前序，否则就累加当前值 public int maxSubArray(int[] nums) { int sum = nums[0]; int max = nums[0]; for(int i=1; i<nums.length; i++){ if(sum<0){ sum = nums[i]; } else { sum += nums[i]; } max = max<sum? sum : max; } return max; } en note 1subarray 这个词指代连续的一段子数组 152.Maximum Product Subarray12345计算截至到当前数字的最大区间的最大积Math.max(mn*nums[i], Math.max(mx*nums[i], nums[i]));，和最大区间的最小积Math.min(mn*nums[i], Math.min(mx*nums[i], nums[i]));，和当前最大积result也是类似dp的思路，只是记录两个dp 1234567891011121314151617public int maxProduct(int[] nums) { if(nums.length == 0){ return 0; } int result = nums[0]; int mxResult = nums[0]; int mnResult = nums[0]; for(int i=1; i<nums.length; i++){ int current = nums[i]; int mx = mxResult, mn = mnResult; mxResult = Integer.max(current*mn, Integer.max(current, current*mx)); mnResult = Integer.min(current*mn, Integer.min(current, current*mx)); result = Integer.max(result, mxResult); } return result;} code如果用全部dp 12345678910111213141516class Solution { public int maxProduct(int[] nums) { int len = nums.length; int[] max = new int[len]; int[] min = new int[len]; max[0] = nums[0]; min[0] = nums[0]; int result = nums[0]; for (int i=1; i<len; i++) { max[i] = Integer.max(max[i-1] * nums[i], Integer.max(nums[i], min[i-1] * nums[i])); min[i] = Integer.min(max[i-1] * nums[i], Integer.min(nums[i], min[i-1] * nums[i])); result = Integer.max(result, max[i]); } return result; }} 153.Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array二分法，找不是ascending的那两个数字感悟这个比较过程，当med小于high时候，说明med到high都是顺序，则pivot可能在left到med之间，所以high=med. 123这个算法有两个点注意1：中间点是final int m = (left + right) / 2;2：先检查后半部分是否符合标准，符合则right=m；不符合则left=m+1；这样不会出现越界现象，中间点赋值时候不会等于右边点。 code 用一个for循环，注意返回值是值不是index 1234567891011class Solution { public int findMin(int[] nums) { int result = 0; for (int i=1; i<nums.length; i++) { if (nums[i] < nums[i-1]) { return nums[i]; } } return nums[0]; }} 12345678910111213141516171819class Solution { public int findMin(int[] nums) { int len = nums.length; int left = 0; int right = len - 1; while(left<right){ int med = left + (right - left)/2; if(nums[med]<nums[right]){ right = med; } else{ left = med + 1; } } return nums[left]; }} 33.Search in Rotated Sorted ArrayPrior to being passed to your function, 在。。之前 需要背 首先给定的数组分为两部分，前升序和后升序。这里的后升序的最大值小于前升序的最小值。 然后先找med的值，和target比较。再和left和right比较，在这个区间就缩小范围，不在这个区间就尝试下另外一个范围。 1nums[0]<=nums[med] 先用上面的代码分出前还是后升序 然后再分出是有序部分还是无序部分 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132class Solution { public int search(int[] nums, int target) { int len = nums.length; if(len == 0){ return -1; } int l = 0; int r = len - 1; while(l<=r) { int m = (l+r) / 2; if(nums[m] == target) { return m; } if(nums[m] < nums[r]) { if(target > nums[m] && target <= nums[r]) { l = m+1; } else { r = m -1; } } else { if(nums[l]<=target && target < nums[m]){ r = m-1; } else{ l= m+1; } } } return -1; }} 15.3Sum需要背，现在也不用背了 先排序 两个For 循环（进入循环后去重） + 双指针 1关于not contain duplicate triplets的问题，可以自己查重，也可以用set去重 code 123456789101112131415161718192021222324class Solution { public List<List<Integer>> threeSum(int[] nums) { Set<List<Integer>> set = new HashSet(); List<List<Integer>> list = new ArrayList(); Arrays.sort(nums); for (int i = 0; i < nums.length-2; i++){ int j=i+1; int k=nums.length-1; while(j<k){ if(nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0){ set.add(Arrays.asList(nums[i], nums[j], nums[k])); j++; k--; } else if(nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] < 0) { j++; } else { k--; } } } list.addAll(set); return list; }} 11.Container With Most Water双指针，往里面缩短板，可能会得到更大的面积，往里面缩长板，长变小，高不变，一定会得到更小的面积。因此策略是双指针向内缩短板。注意： 123Math.abs(l-r)Integer.max()Integer.min() 1234567891011121314151617181920class Solution { public int maxArea(int[] height) { int len = height.length; int l = 0; int r = len - 1; int highest = 0; int result = 0; while(l<r) { if(Integer.min(height[l], height[r]) * Math.abs(l-r) > result){ result = Integer.min(height[l], height[r]) * Math.abs(l-r); } if (height[l] < height[r]){ l++; } else { r--; } } return result; }} Binary 5 位运算不想看371.Sum of Tow Integers不能用+-符号，思路是位运算符号 12345bit-wise operators & (and), | (or), ~ (not) and ^ (exclusive-or, xor) and shift operators a << b and a >> b.进位 carry进位的值用 a & b 然后左移1位 最终表示为：(a&b) << 1无进位的值 a ^ b二者的值相加，直到进位为0（也就是没有需要进1的位），说明本轮这次a ^ b就是最终结果。 191.Number of 1 Bits1234567每次n & (n−1)都把n的最低的1位变成了0，所以统计这个运算的次数 int output=0; while(n!=0){ n &= (n-1); output++; } return output; 338.Counting Bits4种解法，基本是动态规划的逻辑，用已经算出的数字推演当前数字 268.Missing Number123456789101112public int missingNumber(int[] nums) { int xor = 0; int n = nums.length; for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) { xor ^= nums[i]; } for (int i = 0; i <= n; i++) { xor ^= i; } return xor;}// 当一个数字^两次同样的数字后为0 190.Reverse Bits左右不停颠倒题。。。123456789101112131415161718192021public int reverseBits(int n) { int rev = 0; for (int i = 0; i < 32 && n != 0; ++i) { rev |= (n & 1) << (31 - i); n >>>= 1; } return rev;}private static final int M1 = 0x55555555; // 01010101010101010101010101010101private static final int M2 = 0x33333333; // 00110011001100110011001100110011private static final int M4 = 0x0f0f0f0f; // 00001111000011110000111100001111private static final int M8 = 0x00ff00ff; // 00000000111111110000000011111111public int reverseBits(int n) { n = n >>> 1 & M1 | (n & M1) << 1; n = n >>> 2 & M2 | (n & M2) << 2; n = n >>> 4 & M4 | (n & M4) << 4; n = n >>> 8 & M8 | (n & M8) << 8; return n >>> 16 | n << 16;} Dynamic Programming 1170.Climbing Stairs123上台阶，一次可以上1级或者2级台阶，问多少种走法当i>=3时候output[i] = output[i-1] + output[i-2]; 我这个从0阶开始的，这个动态规划比较好理解 1234567891011121314class Solution { public int climbStairs(int n) { if(n<2){ return 1; } int[] dp = new int[n+1]; dp[0] = 1; dp[1] = 1; for(int i=2; i<=n; i++){ dp[i] = dp[i-1] + dp[i-2]; } return dp[n]; }} 322.Coin Change12345dp 只一个数组的解法，长度是amount+1初始化用Arrays.fill(dp, amount+1); db[0]=0两个for循环,外循环是amount,从1开始，内循环是coins的长度，从0开始最后比较dp[amount]值是否被改变过难点在dp[i] = Math.min(dp[i], dp[i - coins[j]] + 1); 12345678910111213141516class Solution { public int coinChange(int[] coins, int amount) { int output = 0; int[] dp = new int[amount + 1]; Arrays.fill(dp, amount+1); dp[0] = 0; for(int i=1; i<amount+1; i++){ for(int j=0; j<coins.length; j++){ if(coins[j] <= i){ dp[i] = Math.min(dp[i], dp[i - coins[j]] + 1); } } } return dp[amount]>amount? -1: dp[amount]; }} [TOC] 300.Longest Increasing Subsequence1234567891011121314151617public int lengthOfLIS(int[] nums) { if(nums.length<=1){ return nums.length; } int[] dp = new int[nums.length]; Arrays.fill(dp, 1); int output = 1; for(int i=1; i<nums.length; i++){ for(int j=i-1; j>=0; j--){ if(nums[j]<nums[i]){ dp[i] = Math.max(dp[i], dp[j]+1); output = Math.max(output, dp[i]); } } } return output; } 1每次记录output 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728// dp算法很好理解，以下是贪心d数组记录每个i位置的最小结尾数字，不断更新这个结尾数字。用二分提高查找效率，这个算法不好理解 public int lengthOfLIS(int[] nums) { int len = 1, n = nums.length; if (n == 0) { return 0; } int[] d = new int[n + 1]; d[len] = nums[0]; for (int i = 1; i < n; ++i) { if (nums[i] > d[len]) { d[++len] = nums[i]; } else { int l = 1, r = len, pos = 0; // 如果找不到说明所有的数都比 nums[i] 大，此时要更新 d[1]，所以这里将 pos 设为 0 while (l <= r) { int mid = (l + r) >> 1; if (d[mid] < nums[i]) { pos = mid; l = mid + 1; } else { r = mid - 1; } } d[pos + 1] = nums[i]; } } return len; } 1143.Longest Common Subsequence1234如果相等，就dp[i-1][j-1] + 1如果不等，就Math.max(dp[i-1][j], dp[i][j-1])字符串返回特定index上的字符是str.charAt(index)或者先把字符串打成数组：str.toCharArray() 123456789101112131415161718public static int longestCommonSubsequence(String text1, String text2) { int[][] dp = new int[text2.length() + 1][text1.length() + 1]; for(int i=0; i<text2.length()+1; i++){ int[] cur = new int[text1.length() + 1]; dp[i] = cur; if(i!=0){ for(int j=1; j<text1.length() + 1; j++){ if(text1.charAt(j-1) == text2.charAt(i-1)){ dp[i][j] = dp[i-1][j-1] + 1; } else{ dp[i][j] = Math.max(dp[i][j-1], dp[i-1][j]); } } } } return dp[text2.length()][text1.length()];} 139.Word Break12主要是条件不好想dp[j] && set.contains(s.substring(j, i)) 1234567891011121314public boolean wordBreak(String s, List<String> wordDict) { Set<String> set = new HashSet(wordDict); boolean[] dp = new boolean[s.length() + 1]; dp[0] = true; for(int i=0; i<=s.length(); i++){ for(int j=0; j<i; j++){ if(dp[j] && set.contains(s.substring(j, i))){ dp[i] = true; break; } } } return dp[s.length()];} 377.Combination Sum IV123这个dp代表当前target从0-target值每一轮是当前硬币组成当前target的可能性，只考虑当前硬币在当前位置上dp[i] += dp[i-num] 123456789101112public int combinationSum4(int[] nums, int target) { int[] dp = new int[target + 1]; dp[0] = 1; for(int i=1; i<=target; i++){ for(int coin:nums){ if(coin<=i){ dp[i] += dp[i-coin]; } } } return dp[target];} 198.House Robber1234567891011121314// 一次迈两步还是一次迈三步的问题，这个问题比较简单public int rob(int[] nums) { int[] dp = new int[nums.length + 1]; dp[0] = 0; dp[1] = nums[0]; for(int i=2; i<=nums.length; i++){ if(i-3<0){ dp[i] = dp[i-2] + nums[i-1]; } else{ dp[i] = Math.max(dp[i-3], dp[i-2]) + nums[i-1]; } } return Math.max(dp[nums.length], dp[nums.length-1]);} 213.House Robber II1闭环以后，逻辑就变成(0, len-2)或者(1, len-1)谁更大的问题，这题要考虑len==1和len==2的情况 12345678910111213141516171819public int rob(int[] nums) { int length = nums.length; if (length == 1) { return nums[0]; } else if (length == 2) { return Math.max(nums[0], nums[1]); } return Math.max(robRange(nums, 0, length - 2), robRange(nums, 1, length - 1)); } public int robRange(int[] nums, int start, int end) { int first = nums[start], second = Math.max(nums[start], nums[start + 1]); for (int i = start + 2; i <= end; i++) { int temp = second; second = Math.max(first + nums[i], second); first = temp; } return second; } 91.Decode Ways12345转移方程1：当第i个字符不是'0',说明当前字符自成一个字母，那么dp[i] = dp[i-1]2：当第i-1个字符不是'0'，且第i-1个字符和第i个字符能组成一个新的字符，也就是<=26，则dp[i] = dp[i-2]上述2点可能同时发生，因此第二条应该累加 dp[i] += dp[i-2]，且当i为起始点的时候没有第i-1的字符。考虑到index，文中的i应该对应index的i-1 1234567891011121314public int numDecodings(String s) { int len = s.length(); int[] dp = new int[len + 1]; dp[0] = 1; for(int i=1; i<=len; i++){ if(s.charAt(i-1) != '0'){ dp[i] = dp[i-1]; } if(i>1 && s.charAt(i-2) !='0' && 10 * (s.charAt(i-2)-'0') + s.charAt(i-1) - '0' <= 26){ dp[i] += dp[i-2]; } } return dp[len];} wed_115pm 62.Unique Paths1计算一个二维数组从左上到右下有多少个不同的路径，属于dp范例问题，用两个数组实现。 1234567891011121314public int uniquePaths(int m, int n) { int[] first = new int[n]; int[] second = new int[n]; Arrays.fill(first, 1); for(int i=1; i<m; i++){ second[0] = 1; for(int j=1; j<n; j++){ second[j] = second[j-1] + first[j]; } first = second; } return first[n-1];} 55.Jump Game1234567891011121314151617// 不算动态规划，是贪心问题，思路比较简单，注意当最长距离小于当前轮次就要结束循环了 public boolean canJump(int[] nums) { int target = 0; for(int i=0; i<nums.length; i++){ if(i>target){ break; } if(i+nums[i] > target){ target = i + nums[i]; } } if(target >= nums.length - 1){ return true; } else { return false; } } Graph 8133.Clone GraphGraph的基本结构 深度优先和广度优先遍历 123广度优先 queuequeue.addqueue.remove 12345678910111213141516// 深度优先 if(node == null){ return null; } if(visited.containsKey(node)){ return visited.get(node); } List<Node> neighbors = new ArrayList(); Node cur = new Node(node.val, new ArrayList()); visited.put(node, cur); for(Node original:node.neighbors){ Node newNode = cloneGraph(original); cur.neighbors.add(newNode); } return cur; 123456789101112131415161718192021//广度优先if(node == null){ return null;}Map<Node, Node> visited = new HashMap();LinkedList<Node> queue = new LinkedList();queue.add(node); // rootvisited.put(node, new Node(node.val, new ArrayList<Node>()));while(!queue.isEmpty()){ Node head = queue.remove(); for (Node neighbor: head.neighbors) { if(!visited.containsKey(neighbor)){ visited.put(neighbor, new Node(neighbor.val, new ArrayList<Node>())); outputl = l; output= r-l+1; } l--; r++; } else{ break; } } l = i; r = i+1; while(l>=0 && r<len){ if(s.charAt(l) == s.charAt(r)){ if(r-l+1 > output){ outputr=r; outputl = l; output= r-l+1; } l--; r++; } else{ break; } } } return s.substring(outputl, outputr+1);} 3.马拉车，这是真复杂，不想看了 647.Palindromic Substrings其实跟上边那题目一样，只是返回值不同 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132public int countSubstrings(String s) { if(s.length()<2){ return s.length(); } int len = s.length(); int result = 0; for(int i=0; i<len; i++){ int l = i; int r = i; while(l>=0 && r<len){ if(s.charAt(l) == s.charAt(r)){ result++; l--; r++; } else{ break; } } l = i; r = i+1; while(l>=0 && r<len){ if(s.charAt(l) == s.charAt(r)){ result++; l--; r++; } else{ break; } } } return result; } 计算Palin drome的时候，要考虑奇数偶数，用小于2n-1限制i，i/2和i/2+n%2确定左右边界。当i为偶数，左右边界相同，i为奇数，r比l大1，左右边界以中心线为对称线。 1234567801234i n 2n-1 L R0 5 9 0 01 5 9 0 12 1 13 1 27 5 9 3 48 5 9 4 4 第二种方法是Manacher 271.encode and decode strings 这题是会员题目。。。12345678910111213141516171819public String encode(List<String> strs){ StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(); for(String str : strs){ sb.append(str.length()).append("/").append(str); } return sb.toString();}public List<String> decode(String s){ List<String> res = new ArrayList<>(); int i=0; while(i<s.length()){ int slash = s.indexOf('/', i); int size = Integer.valueOf(s.substring(i, slash)); res.add(s.substring(slash + 1, slash + 1 + size)); i = slash + 1 + size; // 防止非各位数字 for example: 16 } return res;} Tree104.Maximum Depth of Binary Tree如果用DFS，则 max(l,r)+1 BFD, 则每次扩展到下一层深度+1 12345678910public int maxDepth(TreeNode root) { int ans = 0; if(root == null){ return 0; } else{ int left = maxDepth(root.left) + 1; int right = maxDepth(root.right) + 1; return Math.max(left, right); }} 1234567891011121314151617181920212223 public int maxDepth(TreeNode root) {if(root == null){ return 0; } int ans = 0; Queue<TreeNode> queue = new LinkedList(); queue.offer(root); while(!queue.isEmpty()){ int size = queue.size(); while(size > 0){ TreeNode node = queue.poll(); if(node.left != null){ queue.offer(node.left); } if(node.right != null){ queue.offer(node.right); } size--; } ans++; }return ans; } 100.Same Tree判断两个binary tree 是否 identical， 用BFS，DFS. BFS最后要看Queue里面是否为空，否则二者长度不同，肯定不相等。 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556/ public boolean isSameTree(TreeNode p, TreeNode q) { // if(p==null && q==null){ // return true; // } // if(p!=null && q!=null && p.val == q.val){ // // 下一层 // return isSameTree(p.left, q.left) && isSameTree(p.right, q.right); // } else { // return false; // } // } public boolean isSameTree(TreeNode p, TreeNode q) { if(p==null && q==null){ return true; } else if(p==null ^ q==null) { return false; } else{ // 都不为空就真的要对比值 if(p.val != q.val){ return false; } else{ Queue<TreeNode> q1 = new LinkedList(); Queue<TreeNode> q2 = new LinkedList(); q1.offer(p); q2.offer(q); while(!q1.isEmpty() && !q2.isEmpty()){ TreeNode one= q1.poll(); TreeNode two= q2.poll(); if(one.val != two.val){ return false; } TreeNode l1 = one.left; TreeNode r1 = one.right; TreeNode l2 = two.left; TreeNode r2 = two.right; if(l1==null ^ l2==null){ return false; } if(r1==null ^ r2==null){ return false; } if(l1!=null && l2!=null){ q1.offer(l1); q2.offer(l2); } if(r1!=null && r2!=null){ q1.offer(r1); q2.offer(r2); } } return q1.isEmpty() && q2.isEmpty(); } } } 226.Invert Binary Tree左右翻转 123456789public TreeNode invertTree(TreeNode root) { if(root == null){ return root; } TreeNode temp = root.left; root.left = invertTree(root.right); root.right=invertTree(temp); return root;} 124.Binary Tree Maximum Path Sum （Hard）递归，返回包含当前节点的最大半截链。返回结果是历史最大长链。 123456789101112131415161718public int ans = Integer.MIN_VALUE;public int maxPathSum(TreeNode root) { // 返回当前节点的最大贡献值 // return the maximum donation of current node maxDon(root); return ans; // 因为返回的值，不是递归的返回值(含当前节点的半截链)，是其中的链最大值}public int maxDon(TreeNode root){ if(root == null){ return 0; } int left = Math.max(0, maxDon(root.left)); int right = Math.max(0, maxDon(root.right)); int donation = root.val + left + right; ans = Math.max(ans, donation); return root.val + Math.max(left, right);} 123456789101112131415161718192021public TreeNode invertTree(TreeNode root) { if(root == null){ return root; } Queue<TreeNode> queue = new LinkedList<>(); queue.offer(root); while(!queue.isEmpty()){ TreeNode node = queue.poll(); TreeNode temp = node.left; node.left = node.right; node.right = temp; if(node.left != null){ queue.offer(node.left); } if(node.right!=null){ queue.offer(node.right); } } return root;} 102.Binary Tree Level Order Traversal广度优先遍历，要求结果一层一个数组（list） 12注意generics的写法List<List<Integer>> ret = new ArrayList<List<Integer>>(); 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526public List<List<Integer>> levelOrder(TreeNode root) { List<List<Integer>> ret = new ArrayList<List<Integer>>(); if (root == null) { return ret; } Queue<TreeNode> queue = new LinkedList<TreeNode>(); queue.offer(root); while (!queue.isEmpty()) { List<Integer> level = new ArrayList<Integer>(); int currentLevelSize = queue.size(); for (int i = 1; i <= currentLevelSize; ++i) { TreeNode node = queue.poll(); level.add(node.val); if (node.left != null) { queue.offer(node.left); } if (node.right != null) { queue.offer(node.right); } } ret.add(level); } return ret;} 297.Serialize and Deserialize Binary Tree123数组转ListArrays.asList(strings[])List<String> list = new ArrayList(Arrays.asList(strings[])); 体力活，不想看，官方是先序遍历 572.Subtree of Another Tree这不遍历加对比么，样本要一直对比到Null节点 遍历对比的时间负责都是 O(∣s∣×∣t∣)，后面的两种方法可以缩短发杂度，但比较复杂 105.Construct Binary Tree from Preorder and Inorder Traversal用前序遍历和中序遍历构造二叉树 用确定根节点的方法可以构建找个结构，Otime为n，每次调用递归可以得到一个根节点的位置。 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536// preorder = [3,9,20,15,7], inorder = [9,3,15,20,7]private Map<Integer, Integer> indexMap;public TreeNode myBuildTree(int[] preorder, int[] inorder, int preorder_left, int preorder_right, int inorder_left, int inorder_right) { if (preorder_left > preorder_right) { return null; } // 前序遍历中的第一个节点就是根节点 int preorder_root = preorder_left; // 在中序遍历中定位根节点 int inorder_root = indexMap.get(preorder[preorder_root]); // 先把根节点建立出来 TreeNode root = new TreeNode(preorder[preorder_root]); // 得到左子树中的节点数目 int size_left_subtree = inorder_root - inorder_left; // 递归地构造左子树，并连接到根节点 // 先序遍历中「从 左边界+1 开始的 size_left_subtree」个元素就对应了中序遍历中「从 左边界 开始到 根节点定位-1」的元素 root.left = myBuildTree(preorder, inorder, preorder_left + 1, preorder_left + size_left_subtree, inorder_left, inorder_root - 1); // 递归地构造右子树，并连接到根节点 // 先序遍历中「从 左边界+1+左子树节点数目 开始到 右边界」的元素就对应了中序遍历中「从 根节点定位+1 到 右边界」的元素 root.right = myBuildTree(preorder, inorder, preorder_left + size_left_subtree + 1, preorder_right, inorder_root + 1, inorder_right); return root;}public TreeNode buildTree(int[] preorder, int[] inorder) { int n = preorder.length; // 构造哈希映射，帮助我们快速定位根节点 indexMap = new HashMap<Integer, Integer>(); for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) { indexMap.put(inorder[i], i); } return myBuildTree(preorder, inorder, 0, n - 1, 0, n - 1);} 98.Validate Binary Search Tree230.Kth Smallest Element in a BST1中序遍历，基本思想是利用Stack，两个While循环，内循环压入左节点，外循环弹出节点并且压入右侧节点 1234567891011121314151617// 中序遍历public int kthSmallest(TreeNode root, int k) { Deque<TreeNode> stack = new ArrayDeque<>(); while(!stack.isEmpty() || root!=null){ while(root!=null){ stack.push(root); root = root.left; } TreeNode cur = stack.pop(); k--; if(k==0){ return cur.val; } root = cur.right; } return 0;} 1234567891011121314151617181920public int kthSmallest(TreeNode root, int k) { int leftNodes = countNodes(root.left); if(leftNodes < k - 1){ //答案存在右子树中 return kthSmallest(root.right,k - leftNodes - 1); }else if(leftNodes == k - 1){ return root.val; }else{ return kthSmallest(root.left,k); }}//左神递归套路分析左右子树返回信息只需要节点数，因此无需额外定义数据结构public int countNodes(TreeNode root){ //base case返回0 if(root == null) return 0; //递归处理左右子树并接收返回值 int leftNodes = countNodes(root.left); int rightNodes = countNodes(root.right); //判断分析本层递归返回值的具体值 return leftNodes + rightNodes + 1;} 235.Lowest Common Ancestor of Binary Search Tree1234567891011121314// 一次遍历法public TreeNode lowestCommonAncestor(TreeNode root, TreeNode p, TreeNode q) { TreeNode ancestor = root; while(ancestor != null){ if(ancestor.val > p.val && ancestor.val > q.val){ ancestor = ancestor.left; } else if(ancestor.val < p.val && ancestor.val < q.val){ ancestor = ancestor.right; } else{ break; } } return ancestor;} Heap23.重复题目，不做展示 347.Top K Frequent Elements123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930// 最小堆public int[] topKFrequent(int[] nums, int k) { Map<Integer, Integer> occurrences = new HashMap<Integer, Integer>(); for (int num : nums) { occurrences.put(num, occurrences.getOrDefault(num, 0) + 1); } // int[] 的第一个元素代表数组的值，第二个元素代表了该值出现的次数 PriorityQueue<int[]> queue = new PriorityQueue<int[]>(new Comparator<int[]>() { public int compare(int[] m, int[] n) { return m[1] - n[1]; } }); for (Map.Entry<Integer, Integer> entry : occurrences.entrySet()) { int num = entry.getKey(), count = entry.getValue(); if (queue.size() == k) { if (queue.peek()[1] < count) { queue.poll(); queue.offer(new int[]{num, count}); } } else { queue.offer(new int[]{num, count}); } } int[] ret = new int[k]; for (int i = 0; i < k; ++i) { ret[i] = queue.poll()[0]; } return ret;} 295.Find Median from Data Stream (Hard)

posts.title: Horseman BoJack
posts.text: Horseman BoJack[TOC] S01E01situation comedy 情景喜剧 premiere v.n. 首映 premiered on 首映于。。 1The show, in which a young, bachelor horse is forced to reevaluate his priorities when he agrees to raise three human children, was initially dismissed by critics as broad and saccharine and not good, but the family comedy struck a chord with America and went on to air for nine seasons. is forced to 被迫。。 reevaluate v 重新考虑 raise v 提起，增加，抚养 dismiss v 驳回，放弃，解雇 critic n 批评家，批判者，反对者 broad a 宽广的；粗俗的，土味十足的 saccharine a 夸张的，故作多情的 struck a chord with 与。。产生共鸣 strike 敲击，捶打，打击，罢工 go on to air 继续直播 go on 继续 go on doing something/ go on with something park in 停车停在 handicapped spot 残障停车位/区域 handicap 障碍，残障，弱智 v 妨碍 这个词语形容残疾人的时候略贬义 spot 斑点，污渍；疱疹；位置，地点，场所 parking spot/ parking lot 停机坪、停车场 disabled spot 残疾人专用区域 proper a 适合的 nomenclature 术语，命名法，名称 terminology 术语 nailing <俚语> 极好的/极好地 nail本来是钉子的意思 我分析这个词后面直接加名词 I am nailing this interview. 这个词语源于hit the nail on the head 表示一针见血 12345678“Nailing” 确实可以用来表示某人把某件事做得非常棒，通常带有完成得很出色或精准的意思。以下是几个用 “nailing” 造的句子：She’s really nailing that presentation—the audience is totally engaged.You’ve been nailing every coding challenge lately, keep up the great work!He nailed the interview and got the job offer on the spot.After weeks of practice, they’re finally nailing the choreography for the performance.You’re nailing this recipe—it tastes amazing!在这些句子中，“nailing” 都表示某人成功地、出色地完成了某件事 appeal 上诉，吸引力 wide appeal 广泛的吸引力 attribute n 属性，象征 v 归因于 PS.这句开头用to是因为attribute to 归因于。。 1To what do you attribute the show's wide appeal? shit all over 把。。贬的一文不值 我觉得这么理解文雅一点 solid 坚实可靠的； 固体 urethra 尿道，膀胱 cancellation 取消 Uhmmmmm 这里的无语奠定了本剧的灰暗悲惨的基调。。。。。 gloomy a 阴沉的，阴郁的 roomie 室友 roommate ie构词法 houseguest 在家过夜或者赞助的客人 put labels on things 给事物下定义/贴标签 tapeworm 绦虫，寄生虫 parasitic 寄生的，依附性的 less parasitic == independent 注意parasitic的重音 in the first place 首先，最开始 kick somebody out 把某人赶出去 secretly 背地里地，暗地里地 approve of v赞成 alternative a 另类的，非传统的 印象里总是形容交替的 realize by 意识到 meant 注意过去式的写法和发音 that’s on you 都是你的责任 assumption 猜测，假设 1That's on you for making assumptions. 都怪你瞎猜 strudel 点心，发面卷 （发音：死猪头 表示苹果派等）toaster strudel 1I would have invited you to my office, but the electric company shut off our power. would have done 本来会。。。 shut off power 切断，关掉，拉闸断电 penguin 企鹅 be eager to do 非常渴望做 memoir 回忆录 keep missing your deadlines 一直错过最后期限/一直拖延 make great progress 取得重大进展 bestseller 畅销书 money wise 或者 money-wise adv 金钱方面，金钱至上 1234Aren't you an editor at a major publishing house?Yeah, a publishing house.When was the last time you saw a book? 注意这个问句I thought I saw someone reading one in the park the other day, but it turned out it was a takeout menu. the other day 上次，几天前 turn out 结果是 takeout 外带，外卖；取出 month to month 逐月，按月 Pinky说 We’re living month to month here. 的意思是 what we earn in one month we spend in the same month. 也就是传说中的“月光” count on v 指望 autobiography 自传 ghostwriter 枪手 knock your ass back to the South Pole 惊讶到把你震回南极 a top priority for me 对我来说是第一位 prom n 舞会 1I improvised that line. improvise v 即兴临场创作 line n 台词 spin 表示风格 give something a spin 一般指对。。进行了修改 it works on every level 一语双关 orphan 孤儿 weigh v 重达 1Todd, I weigh over 1,200 pounds. 我重1200绑以上。 bum out 逐出；伤心 bum 屁股，懒汉；乞讨；使灰心 princess 王妃，公主 dump — dumped you甩了你 check out v 检查，退房，口语里有快看的意思 rug n 小毯子，用于讽刺假发 1Who does he think he's fooling? fool somebody 骗某人 embarrass somebody 让某人尴尬 12I am not crazy about the bread here.Why do I keep eating it? be crazy about something 喜欢某物 undivided 专一的，未分开的 undevided attention 1You have my undivided attention. 表达我全神贯注地听你阐述 1I think we should see other people. 直译：我认为我们应该和别人约会了。 cruller 油炸麻花，油炸面包圈 That’s a horse of a different color. Mulligan 人名。。美国俚语：蔬菜烩肉 1Are you embarrassed of me because I'm a has-been? embarrassed of somebody 被动语态：因为某人丢脸 has-been 过气名人 advance n 进步；预付款 v 提前，进步 这里是预付稿费的意思 explicitly 明确地，显然地 step away 走开，让开 run away 逃走，抛开 1I was running away from my girlfriend whom I don't respect enough to have a baby with. face it 承认吧 be afraid of something commitment n 承诺 following through on 表示对某事的跟进 peanut butter 花生酱 crossover 跨界 sarcastic 讽刺的 12You're being sarcastic, but I think it does actually get funnier every time.你在说反话（反讽） 1would it kill you to be civil? 礼貌点会死么？ 1Could we please have the check? 叫waiter买单时候这么说 premeal 餐前面包，正常是随便吃的 fat ass 大屁股 calories 卡路里 metabolize 新城代谢 1Couldn't hear you over the sound of my calories not metabolizing. throw a party 举行一个party barf v 呕吐；n 呕吐物 duck and roll 蹲下然后滚翻 感觉这个动作描述类似前滚翻 duck 鸭子；蹲下 1I pride myself on my ability to separate my professional life from my personal life. pride on v 以。。为傲 separate v 分开，区别；a 单独的 catnip 猫薄荷 a pile of crap 一坨屎 用pile masturbate v 手淫，打飞机 dire a 危急的，糟糕的 strait 海峡，困境 investment 投资 franchise v.n 特许，经营权 scary 恐怖的，吓人的 swamp 沼泽 grew up before our eyes 在我们眼前长大 secretariat 秘书处；一代骄马 personal hero 个人英雄，心目中的偶像 off the ground 起步 1Could never get the project off the ground. swag box 礼品盒 1easy for you to say, you hippie. hippie 嬉皮士 ie结构 小垃圾的意思 turf n 草皮，地皮 v 用草皮覆盖 better question 更好的问题 这里表示我更想知道的是 dummy 笨蛋 sitcom 情景喜剧 obsess v 痴迷 hand it off to somebody 交给某人 one shot 一击 preserve 保留 legacy 遗产 12This book is my one shot at preserving my legacy.这本书是让我一举流芳百世的遗产。 washed-up 疲倦，不行了的 hack 老家伙 finale 结局，剧终 12We might have gone too dark on that series finale.我们可能在最后一集里太黑暗了。 live off 依靠。。。谋生 make a living 谋生 123Your silence speaks volumes.你的沉默说明了一切。That was my intention. intention n 意图，目的 mild a 温和的，轻度的 anxiety 焦虑 attack v.n 攻击 在这是发作的意思 spicy a辛辣的，刺激的 在这是重度的 salsa joke n 冷笑话 overstressed 压力大 stress somebody out 给某人施加压力 consistent 一致的，始终如一的 pity 怜悯 casual 随便的，轻松的 1I totally hear what you are saying. 我理解你在说什么 senor 先生 西班牙语 generosity n 慷慨，大方 variety of folks 多种多样的人 quinceanera 西语的15岁成人礼 all walks of life 各界人士 racist 种族主义者 pendant 吊坠 kid around 开玩笑 catch up 赶上 在这表示继续谈话，聊天，叙旧 It’s was nice to catch up with you. furious a 狂怒的，激烈的 这里表示兴奋的 mispronounce 发错音 mingle 混合，交融，交际 anxious 焦虑的 broad sense a 广义的 n 宽泛的意义 broad 本集开场出现这个词表示 a 粗俗的in a real broad sense 广义上来说 overthinking 想多了 compliment v.n 赞美，问候 P.S.我们在EnglishPod里学过complimentary a 免费的 throw away 抛弃，浪费，失去 12Yeah, well, if your're gonna throw away most of your adult life on some dumb sitcom, you might as well get a sweet house out of the deal, right?"out of the deal" 的意思是 "从这件事情中" 或 "作为这件事的回报" autograph 亲笔签名 miserable 可怜的，不幸的 envy 嫉妒 profoundly adv 深刻地，严重地 get sick of me 厌烦我 1You would probably get sick of me. 你可能会烦我 that doesn’t count 那不算数 on the clock 正在上班 这里表示我们还没正式签约呢 you got it 没毛病，没问题 penis 阴茎 vagina 阴道 S01E02say when 倒酒场合：你说停就停 when 停 definitely adv 绝对地 hilarious 滑稽的，可笑的 get over here 过来吧 get over 克服 Don’t put things in my butt “别逼我”的非常粗俗的说法 1Don't put things in my butt if you want them back. warhorse 战马 set 安排好的 we are all set. catty a 刁钻刻薄的，阴险的 1Laura, do not respond to him. decency n 得体，正派，礼貌 crappy a 劣质的，糟糕的 crap 拉屎，垃圾，废话 self-conscious a 不自然的，刻意的 than ever 比以往任何时候都。。 be used to doing 习惯做。。 get away with things 逃避责任，随心所欲 have an effect on somebody 影响别人 regrettable 令人遗憾的，令人惋惜的 1234That better not be my last Toaster Strudel.这最好不是我最后一个烤果馅卷。"That better not be my last Toaster Strudel"：这是常见的口语简略形式，省略了 "had" (即 "That had better not...")，但是在口语中人们常常这样表达，语法虽然不完全正式，但广泛接受并且自然。"That'd better not be my last Toaster clay to boulders. When the current slows down, its competence (how much it can carry) decreases and the stream deposits the largest particles in the streambed. If current velocity continues to decrease-as a flood wanes, for example-finer particles settle out on top of the large ones. Thus, a stream sorts its sediment according to size. A waning flood might deposit a layer of gravel, overlain by sand and finally topped by silt and clay. Streams also sort sediment in the downstream direction. Many mountain streams are choked with boulders and cobbles, but far downstream, their deltas are composed mainly of fine silt and clay. This downstream sorting is curious because stream velocity generally increases in the downstream direction. Competence increases with velocity, so a river should be able to transport larger particles than its tributaries carry. One explanation for downstream sorting is that abrasion wears away the boulders and cobbles to sand and silt as the sediment moves downstream over the years. Bars, which are elongated mounds of sediment, are transient features that form in the stream channel and on the banks. They commonly form in one year and erode the next. Rivers used for commercial navigation must be recharted frequently because bars shift from year to year. Imagine a winding stream. The water on the outside of the curve moves faster than the water on the inside. The stream erodes its outside bank because the current`s inertia drives it into the outside bank. At the same time, the slower water on the inside point of the bend deposits sediment, forming a point bar. A mid-channel bar is a sandy and gravelly deposit that forms in the middle of a stream channel. 123456789alluvial n 淤积土 a 冲积的gradient n 倾斜度elongate v 拉长，延长transient a 短暂的form 注意A形成B是A forms Berode v 侵蚀，腐蚀rechart 重新绘制winding a 曲折的inertia n 惯性 Most streams flow in a single channel. In contrast, a braided stream flows in many shallow, interconnecting channels. A braided stream forms where more sediment is supplied to a stream than it can carry. The stream dumps the excess sediment, forming mid-channel bars. The bars gradually fill a channel, forcing the stream to overflow its banks and erode new channels. As a result, a braided stream flows simultaneously in several channels and shifts back and forth across its floodplain. Braided streams are common in both deserts and glacial environments because both produce abundant sediment. A desert yields large amounts of sediment because it has little or no vegetation to prevent erosion. Glaciers grind bedrock into fine sediment, which is carried by streams flowing from the melting ice. If a steep mountain stream flows onto a flat plain, its gradient and velocity decrease sharply. As a result, it deposits most of its sediment in a fan-shaped mound called an alluvial fan. The sediment settles out to form a nearly flat landform called a delta. Part of the delta lies above water level, and the remainder lies slightly below water level. Deltas are commonly fan-shaped, resembling the Greek letter “delta” (Δ). Both deltas and alluvial fans change rapidly. Sediment fills channels (waterways), which are then abandoned while new channels develop as in a braided stream. As a result, a stream feeding a delta or fan splits into many channels called distributaries. Discovering the inputs and outputs of rivers is a matter of measuring the discharges of every inflowing and outflowing stream and river. Then exchanges with the atmosphere are calculated by finding the difference between the gains from rain, as measured (rather roughly) by rain gauges, and the losses by evaporation, measured with models that correct for the other sources of water loss. For the majority of lakes, certainly those surrounded by forests, input from overland flow is too small to have a noticeable effect. Changes in lake level not explained by river flows plus exchanges with the atmosphere must be due to the net difference between what seeps into the lake from the groundwater and what leaks into the groundwater. Snow falls as hexagonal crystals, but once on the ground, snow is soon transformed into a compacted mass of smaller, rounded grains. As the air space around them is lessened by compaction and melting, the grains become denser. With further melting, refreezing, and increased weight from newer snowfall above, the snow reaches a granular recrystallized stage intermediate between flakes and ice known as firn. With additional time, pressure, and refrozen meltwater from above, the small firn granules become larger, interlocked crystals of blue glacial ice. The glacial system is governed by two basic climatic variables: precipitation and temperature. For a glacier to grow or maintain its mass, there must be sufficient snowfall to match or exceed the annual loss through melting, evaporation, and calving, which occurs when the glacier loses solid chunks as icebergs to the sea or to large lakes. If summer temperatures are high for too long, then all the snowfall from the previous winter will melt. Surplus snowfall is essential for a glacier to develop. A surplus allows snow to accumulate and for the pressure of snow accumulated over the years to transform buried snow into glacial ice with a depth great enough for the ice to flow. Although this rise of oil is almost always carefully controlled today, spouts of oil, or gushers, were common in the past. Gas pressure gradually dies out, and oil is pumped from the well. Some oil lies under regions where drilling is forbidden, such as national parks or other public lands. Even given the best extraction techniques, only about 30 to 40 percent of the oil in a given pool can be brought to the surface. The rest is far too difficult to extract and has to remain underground. 12recovered 指的是被回收，被开采extraction n 提取，开采 Moreover, getting petroleum out of the ground and from under the sea and to the consumer can create environmental problems anywhere along the line. Pipelines carrying oil can be broken by faults or landslides, causing serious oil spills. Spillage from huge oil-carrying cargo ships, called tankers, involved in collisions or accidental groundings (such as the one off Alaska in 1989) can create oil slicks at sea. Offshore platforms may also lose oil, creating oil slicks that drift ashore and foul the beaches, harming the environment. Sometimes, the ground at an oil field may subside as oil is removed. The Wilmington field near Long Beach, California, has subsided nine meters in 50 years; protective barriers have had to be built to prevent seawater from flooding the area. Finally, the refining and burning of petroleum and its products can cause air pollution. While rock between two consistent strata might in one place be shale and in another sandstone, the fossils in that shale or sandstone were always the same. Some fossils endured through so many millions of years that they appear in many strata, but others occur only in a few strata, and a few species had their births and extinctions within one particular stratum. About the same time, Georges Cuvier made the same discovery while studying the rocks around Paris. Soon it was realized that this principle of faunal (animal) succession was valid not only in England or France but virtually everywhere. It was actually a principle of floral succession as well, because plants showed the same transformation through time as did fauna. Furthermore, the gypsum was found to possess peculiarities of composition and structure that suggested it had formed on desert flats. The investigators theorized that about 20 million years ago, the Mediterranean was a broad seaway linked to the Atlantic by two narrow straits. Crustal movements closed the straits, and the landlocked Mediterranean began to evaporate. Increasing salinity caused by the evaporation resulted in the extermination of scores of invertebrate species. Only a few organisms especially tolerant of very salty conditions remained. They occur primarily in regions of recent volcanic activity as hot, dry rock; natural hot water; or natural steam. The latter two sources are limited to those few areas where surface water seeps down through underground faults or fractures to reach deep rocks heated by the recent activity of molten rock material. The world’s largest supply of natural steam occurs at The Geysers, 120 kilometers north of San Francisco, California. In the 1990s enough electricity to meet about half the needs of San Francisco was being generated there. This facility was then in its third decade of production and was beginning to show signs of decline, perhaps because of over development. These waters present a disposal problem if they are not returned to the ground from which they were removed. The contribution of geothermal energy to the world’s energy future is difficult to estimate. Geothermal energy is in a sense not renewable, because in most cases the heat would be drawn out of a reservoir much more rapidly than it would be replaced by the very slow geological processes by which heat flows through solid rock into a heat reservoir. However, in many places (for example, California, Hawaii, the Philippines, Japan, Mexico, the rift valleys of Africa) the resource is potentially so large that its future will depend on the economics of production. At present, we can make efficient use of only naturally occurring hot water or steam deposits. Although the potential is enormous, it is likely that in the near future geothermal energy can make important local contributions only where the resource is close to the user and the economics are favorable, as they are in California, New Zealand, and Iceland. The plates have edges that are spreading ridges (where two plates are moving apart and new seafloor is being created), subduction zones (where two plates collide and one plunges beneath the other), or transform faults (where two plates neither converge nor diverge but merely move past one another). The Hawaiian Islands provide a very instructive answer. Like many other island groups, they form a chain. The Hawaiian Island Chain extends northwest from the island of Hawaii. In the 1840s American geologist James Daly observed that the different Hawaiian Islands seem to share a similar geologic evolution but are progressively more eroded, and therefore probably older, toward the northwest. Then in 1963, in the early days of the development of the theory of plate tectonics, Canadian geophysicist Tuzo Wilson realized that this age progression could result if the islands were formed on a surface plate moving over a fixed volcanic source in the interior. Wilson suggested that the long chain of volcanoes stretching northwest from Hawaii is simply the surface expression of a long-lived volcanic source located beneath the tectonic plate in the mantle. Today’s most northwestern island would have been the first to form. Then, as the plate moved slowly northwest, new volcanic islands would have formed as the plate moved over the volcanic source. The most recent island, Hawaii, would be at the end of the chain and is now over the volcanic source. 12progressively ad 逐步地，日渐eroded v 侵蚀 Although this idea was not immediately accepted, the dating of lavas in the Hawaiian (and other) chains showed that their ages increase away from the presently active volcano, just as Daly had suggested. Wilson’s analysis of these data is now a central part of plate tectonics. Most volcanoes that occur in the interiors of plates are believed to be produced by mantle plumes, columns of molten rock that rise from deep within the mantle. A volcano remains an active “hot spot” as long as it is over the plume. The plumes apparently originate at great depths, perhaps as deep as the boundary between the core and the mantle, and many have been active for a very long time. The shutdown passed the 35-day mark, making it the longest ever, breaking the previous record that had been set nearly seven years ago. passed the 35-day mark 过了50天大关 pivotal a 关键性的，核心的 aftermath n 创伤，后果 unrepentant a 毫不后悔的，不思悔改的 portray v 描述 Machiavellian 马基雅维利，阴险狡诈的权谋家Machiavellian figure tore through 迅速穿越 tear thru drown v 淹死，淹没 purport v 声称 purport to show 声称显示 detainee n 被拘留者 seize on something v 猛扑，利用 Allies of Binyamin Netanyahu, the prime minister, seized on the scandal to renew their attack on Israel’s legal establishment. slaughter v.n 屠杀 Islamist 伊斯兰主义者 militant n 斗士，激进分子 entail v 牵涉，引起 terrorist n 恐怖分子 territory n 领土，地盘 civilian n 平民 genocide n 种族灭绝，大屠杀 carried out by 由。。执行 condemn v 谴责，宣判 More reports emerged of something 更多关于。。的报道出现 sworn into office 宣誓就职 aspire v 渴望 accession n 正式加入，就职 praise v 表扬，赞扬 judicial a 司法的 judicial reforms 司法改革 in name 名义上的 transport hub 交通枢纽 acknowledged that 承认 chancellor n （德国或奥地利的）总理 asylum n 庇护，避难 repatriation 遣送回国 flee v 逃避，逃走 populist 民粹主义者 take refuge in 寻求庇护，躲在 presidency n 总统任期 oust v 逐出 fiscal a 财政的 offset v 抵消，弥补 deficit n 赤字，逆差 artefact 文物 on display 公开展示

posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment I have to say the version of NPM, in case I forgot it. 1v18.9.0

posts.title: Leetcode169
posts.text: 插件 1https://github.com/SimplifyJobs/Summer2024-Internships 169地址 1https://www.techinterviewhandbook.org/grind75 [TOC] Week11.Two SumMap要有泛型 hashmap.containsKey(i) hashmap.get(i) hashmap.put(i1,i2) 20.Valid Parentheseshashmap初始化可以写为，注意结尾的引号 123private static final Map<Character, Character> map = new HashMap(){{ put('(',')');put('[',']');put('{','}');}}; str.length() 注意有括号Parentheses Stack可以用linkedlist实现，方法是addLast(c)和removeLast()这个会得到删除的元素 stack.size() 遍历一个字符串时候 Character c:s.toCharArray() 按照index找字符串中的字符时候 str.charAt(index) 防止一上来加入的字符就是后半个括号，向往stack里加一个特殊字符? 也可以使用Deque“代课” deque.pop() deque.push() deque.peek() 21.Merge Two Sorted Lists递归 链表指针的移动 121.Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock卖股票得最大利润 简单题需要记录当前最大利润和记录当前最低点 125.Valid Palindrome 回型文2种思路，1是新建字符串拼接反转后对比，2是在原有基础上双指针对比 StringBuffer的==比较的是地址，equals方法也没被重写，所以对比两个字符串的值等不等需要先toString()再equals() 12345Character.isLetterOrDigit()Character.toLowerCase(ch) Character.toUpperCase(ch) 226.Invert Binary Tree递归，本质是深度优先遍历 depth first traversal如果root为null, 0 就return, 否则做必要动作，然后return root 栈迭代，本质是广度优先遍历 breadth first traversal这个套路是先把root节点加到栈里， 242.Valid Anagram 相同字母异序词 ‘A’ 的ASCII码值是 65。 ‘a’ 的ASCII码值是 97。 ‘Z’ 的ASCII码值是 90。 ‘z’ 的ASCII码值是 122。 第一种方法是Arrays.sort() 然后Arrays.equals(a1, a2) 第二种是用一个alphabet的长度26的array维护统计字符个数，然后看是否数量相等 704.Binary Search二分查找 简单题 733.Flood Fill队列也是用LinkedList实现 queue.offer() 代表添加queue.poll() 删除 第一种方法是Breadth first traversal 什么时候用Queue, 什么时候用Stack需要甄别 这种二维数组画pixel都要考虑边界是否越界 123if (mx >= 0 && mx < image.length && my >= 0 && my < image[0].length) { dfs(image, mx, my, currColor, color);} 235.Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Search Tree找最小祖先 这是Binary Search Tree的正向利用 110.Balanced Binary Tree首先height-balanced Height-Balanced A height-balanced binary tree is a binary tree in which the depth of the two subtrees of every node never differs by more than one. 这个题目用递归，一个方法找当前的height, 一个方法查看当前节点是否balanced 2 just calculate height of current node. If the any descendant of current node is unbalanced, the current node would be unbalanced too. 这种方法just calculate the height of current node. 141.Linked List CycleHashSet 或者 快慢指针 HashSet 中 set.add()方法会返回是否添加成功，因此可以判断是否有重复快慢指针的精髓在于slow每次走一步slow.next, fast每次走两步fast.next.next 232.Implement Queue using Stacks原理是一个栈是入栈，一个栈是出栈，出的时候先看出栈，出栈为空的时候需要有一个从入栈到出栈的压入过程 12345private void in2out() { while (!inStack.isEmpty()) { outStack.push(inStack.pop()); }} Week 2278.First Bad Version本质是binary search，寻找相同情况最左点。 注意这个不是找对应数字，这是找连续数字的最左点。 383，Ransom Note 勒索信str转字符数组str.toCharArray() map.getOrDefault(c, 0) 可以用数组存储26个字符的方式，我用的map存储，两个for循环 Week 357.Insert Interval往一个顺序的且不重叠non-overlapping区间中插入一个新的区间，不能重叠（合并新区间和老区间重叠的部分） 给的是int的二位数组，先新建一个list，最后再循环一边list，把答案导入新的int二维数组。重点是循环原数组，然后将老数组中每一个区间和新区间比较，一共三种情况，重叠就合并。

posts.title: NSQ scripts
posts.text: [TOC] When Do You Become an Adult?MAUGHAN: Angela, we have a fascinating question today about adulthood. DUCKWORTH: “Adulting” or adulthood? MAUGHAN: Well, adulthood, I think, but I think they’re tied together, and I don’t know that I’m good at “adulting.” I don’t know how you are at “adulting,” but it’s kind of forced upon us at a certain age. DUCKWORTH: It is. MAUGHAN: So, here’s the question: “Who decided, and when was it decided, that the age of 18 years old is considered an adult? Why hasn’t this evolved with our understanding of human brain development? Thank you so much for considering my question, Alison.” DUCKWORTH: Oh, so nice, Alison. MAUGHAN: Yeah, I think this is a great question — my favorite is like, “Who decided?” Like, “Who, who are you to tell me that 18 is an adult?” DUCKWORTH: Do you know the answer to that question? Because I know the neuroscience and the psychology on that question, but I don’t know who decided it was that at the age of 18 we are able to vote and do some other things. MAUGHAN: I weirdly do know the answer to that, but before we jump into that, I want to ask you a question first. Was there a time in your life when you finally felt like, “I’m an adult? DUCKWORTH: I think in high school, I actually did have a little vague feeling about this, and it’s partly because my parents, whom I loved and who were caring, were very occupied with raising my older brother and sister and they were a handful. And so, the kinds of things that some parents do, like, “Hey, it’s time for your physical,” or like, “You should probably get an eye exam,” or, “It’s time to send out Christmas cards. And maybe we should put out a jack-o’-lantern because it’s Halloween.” So, basically I did all those things in high school, and they are kind of adult things. So, obviously that was all before I was 18, but honestly, I think my first load of laundry — like, you know that first load of laundry that you do completely by yourself, and you’re, like, paying complete attention to the task. You’re like, “And then the dryer sheet goes in the, dryer.” Like, I think the first load of laundry I did, I was like, “Now I am an adult.” MAUGHAN: See, I think I thought of when did I become an adult, and I remember moving to college — which by the way was 45 minutes away from the home I grew up in. And I thought, “I am an adult now. I’m moving out. I’m on my own.” And those first two weeks, I called home maybe 12 times, because I was so homesick. And I thought, “Maybe I’m not as much of an adult as I thought I was.” DUCKWORTH: Did you drive yourself? Your parents didn’t drop you off? MAUGHAN: No, and that is so funny because it’s become a conversation in my family. My parents were always just like, “Hey, good luck!” My friend Dave Smith and I packed my family’s Suburban — I took half the Suburban, he took half the Suburban — for all of our stuff, and we listened to Billy Joel’s “Moving Out.” And I thought I was an adult, but then I realized that maybe I still need my mom and dad. DUCKWORTH: Well, I absolutely cried when my parents dropped me off. And I remember distinctly the feeling of watching the car get smaller in the distance. And there was just this, like, sinking feeling, and it was like, “I want my mommy.” But yeah, there are these transitions, and, you know, psychologists have been thinking about this forever. But you said you bizarrely know the answer to this. So, who decided that 18 — MAUGHAN: Right. So, Alison, I’m going to answer that. First of all, there’s this thing called “age of majority,” which is different than what’s called the “legal age of license.” So the age of majority is when you are legally considered an adult and fully responsible for your own actions. DUCKWORTH: So, that’s 18. MAUGHAN: Most places now view the age of majority — or age of adulthood, if you will — as 18. Now, there are a few states in the United States — Alabama and Nebraska, for example, say the age of majority is 19. Mississippi says the age of majority is 21. That does not mean, however, that you can’t vote or any of those things. DUCKWORTH: That’s federal, right? MAUGHAN: Right, and so, legal age of license, which is slightly different, that’s when, for example, you can participate in certain activities like drinking alcohol. What’s interesting is the historical fluctuations. And the age of majority, fluctuated over time between being the mid-teens and mid-twenties for what’s adulthood. So, if we go back to the Romans, because everything goes back to the Romans. DUCKWORTH: At least over here, in this part of the world. Go on, yes. MAUGHAN: The Romans in the early days considered 15 for males. They said that’s when they have obtained the intellectual capacities required to exercise full citizenship, manage their affairs, become parents, and the heads of families themselves. Now, for anyone who’s met a 15-year-old, God bless the 15-year-old Romans. DUCKWORTH: Okay, wait, I need to interrupt you very briefly and say it’s possible that 15-year-olds back then were not the same as 15-year-olds now. MAUGHAN: Yes, 100 percent true. But basically this is because they were correlating adulthood with puberty. And the onset of puberty roughly was 15 for males back then. What’s interesting, though, is that they still didn’t trust these 15-year-olds completely, so they would place them under temporary guardianship of adults who were known as “curators,” and the curators would validate any formal action that the 15-year-old took until they reach the age of 25. So, it’s kind this, like, balance between you’re an adult at 15, but you’re a supervised adult for 10 years. DUCKWORTH: Okay, so this is the historical origin of 18. So it started off as 15. MAUGHAN: But then it changes. As the nature of warfare changes, we start to think of adults differently. Hop with me for a minute over to England. So, in the Middle Ages, think about all the weight of defensive armor. And so the age of eligibility for knighthood turns into age 21, because that was when they felt like you could be an actual warrior. DUCKWORTH: Like, you were strong enough. MAUGHAN: Right. And so they change it to 21 if you’re in the military. But the age of adulthood stayed about 14 or 15 if you were an agricultural status. So, I should just say, for centuries, the tradition spread widely because of the role that the English played — 21 became that age of adulthood in much of the world. But it was, once again, war that changed it in the U.S. to 18 because we didn’t have enough people that were entering the military. So, in 1942, Congress lowered the age of conscription into the military from 21 to 18, and then that led to the 26th Amendment in the United States, where it was like, “Hey, look, if you can send me into war at 18, then I want to be able to vote at 18.” DUCKWORTH: Ah, so voting followed the draft. MAUGHAN: Yes, because it was like, look, if you can send me into war, I should be able to vote for who my leaders are. And then, kind of everything flowed from there, that 18 became the age. And it’s so interesting that so much of it comes down to warfare. Not psychology, not brain development, not maturity, but warfare. DUCKWORTH: So, in the kind of like, “Well, who decided?” It sounds like there are political — I guess you could say pragmatic, but definitely political forces that say 15, 18, 21. Okay, back to 18. Well, 21 for this, 18 for that, right? MAUGHAN: Or if you’re on the farm, then we need you to be an adult earlier, versus if you’re out there fighting a battle, we’re going to call it something different. DUCKWORTH: Well, the thing you said about there are two bright lines — you said there’s an age of majority, which is kind of a confusing expression except for when you think of children and teenagers as being minors. I guess that’s why it’s called the age of majority. You are no longer a minor. But then, there is the blah, blah, blah, blah about license? What was that phrase? MAUGHAN: The legal age of license. DUCKWORTH: Somehow, like, that phrase sounded, like, so long to me, but okay, again, the legal age of license. So, that being a different bright line, that’s a different demarcation for adulthood, at least in terms of our laws. So, that one was, you said it was like drinking, for example, and — MAUGHAN: Yeah, and they can match up or they might not. So, if you look at some of the history: when Prohibition ended in 1933, most states set the drinking age to 21, which at the time also equated to the voting age. That continued until, again, we talked about this —. DUCKWORTH: We needed soldiers, yeah, the draft. MAUGHAN: Yeah, that’s when we moved the voting age to 18 with the Constitutional Amendment. A bunch of states, in turn, lowered the drinking age to 18. But then, in 1984, President Reagan comes in and he says, “Look, you need to raise the drinking age because of drinking and driving.” It became this massive national problem, especially on kids who hadn’t quite developed the brain function, etc. So, he basically strong-arms all of Congress to pass this National Minimum Drinking Age Act, where he said that if states don’t raise the drinking age from 18 to 21, then he would cut funding for their federal highway funds. So he forced all these states to raise the drinking age to 21, but it had been 18. DUCKWORTH: Until Reagan? I did not know that. And are all states in the United States 21 for drinking? MAUGHAN: Yes, so every state abides by the standard of age 21 for drinking. DUCKWORTH: Okay, so here’s what I want to say about the age of majority and the legal age of license. So, when you’re a child, you’re a child. And when you’re an adult, you’re an adult. And I guess different societies have made the bright line differently. But there’s also this stage that is in between childhood and adulthood. I think every society would agree that it’s not childhood to adulthood, it’s childhood to adolescence to adulthood. One of my favorite adolescent psychologists is Larry Steinberg. And he is one of the world experts on this transitional stage, right? I think one thing Larry would want everyone to know is that all mammals have adolescence. It’s a phase that is biological, and it is this transition sexually. So, you know, the hormones change, you develop the ability to reproduce. And during that stage, you actually also engage in a bunch of behaviors that are true across mammals. And I find this fascinating, because there is a kind of teenage phase — even for, like, mice and rats. MAUGHAN: I’m just thinking about, like, elephants being teenagers and, like, getting in trouble and testing the rules. DUCKWORTH: Right. I think what’s so funny is that during this stage, you know, adolescent mammals do, like, stupidass things, like, risk-taking, sensation-seeking behaviors. And so, one of the things that Larry has thought hard about as a prominent adolescent psychologist is: when should these bright lines be made? And he’s smart enough to understand that no policymaker can handle like, “Well, it shouldn’t be —” like, you need to have bright lines. He kind of understands that even though there’s complexity, you cannot govern a society where you’re like, “For this, it’s 16 and a half, except for if this person hasn’t reached this milestone.” I mean, he gets it. MAUGHAN: Right, that’s what’s so tricky, because the development of individuals is not uniform, but to your point, from a policy-making standpoint, you can’t have just a mushy middle forever, so we have to draw these lines. DUCKWORTH: So, he has these two lines as well. So, he wrote this article in 2019, so not that long ago with a postdoc named Grace Icenogle, and it’s entitled, “Using Developmental Science to Distinguish Adolescents and Adults Under the Law.” And, you know, he summarizes decades of research, including the neuroscience on brain development. And he says, “Look, we need two lines. Here’s one line.” And this line comes earlier. By age 16 — Larry wants to argue, and I would agree with him — it’s at that age at our capacity to reason logically is actually fully mature. MAUGHAN: At 16? DUCKWORTH: At 16. Now, by the way, you can point to these 16-year-olds and you’re like, “Seriously?” But he makes this distinction. He said it’s in cool decision-making contexts. In other words, like, not emotional, not peer-pressured. But if you actually give 16-year-olds logic puzzles, and, like, reasoning puzzles, they are just as good, if not better, honestly, than many of their older family members. For example, voting, you know, thinking about the upcoming election when obviously our voting rules are not going to change. I think Larry would argue that 16-year-olds should be fully capable of reasoning in a cool context. Now, you might not argue that this election is a cool context, but I think this is what he means. MAUGHAN: And “cool” not meaning, um, fun, popular. Cool as in, like, non-emotional. DUCKWORTH: Oh, yes. Not Stanley Cups and Adidas Sambas, but, like, “cool” as in not emotionally hot. He says, it’s a different thing when you’re asked to make decisions in a hot context. That’s one that, you know, there’s time pressure, there’s peer pressure, and there’s something emotional. Like, say you’re angry. That’s actually where teenagers get in trouble. Teenagers actually do not get into trouble in, like, pencil and paper hypothetical scenarios. They do not make stupid decisions. But when they’re with their friends and they’re in these, like, emotional, anger-inducing, or embarrassment-inducing, or, and also, you know, I mentioned this, like, thrill-seeking and sensation-seeking. Whenever I talk to undergraduates, I mean, I sound like that old person, but I do tell them, I’m like, “If you can get through this period of time, as you move into your mid-twenties, the urge to do those stupidass things, it just fades. Like, this one kid in my class was like, “So Dr. Duckworth, do you mean this? When I was a kid, well, not that long ago, actually, I guess I was in high school, there was a steep hill near my house. And I would ride my bike to the top of the hill, and then I would go down as fast as I could, with no brakes, right through an intersection.” MAUGHAN: Oh my gosh. DUCKWORTH: “Again and again, because it was fun.” And he was like, “And Dr. Duckworth, I, I kinda think that’s crazy now, like, I would never do that.” And I’m like, “Yeah, that’s what I mean.” MAUGHAN: So, here’s this distinction, though, that sounds like you’re making is: this kind of cold-decision making. In other words, like, the rational, thoughtful, analytical, logical. And then, there’s the hot, and the hot takes a lot longer to master, if ever. I don’t know that any of us ever master this idea of peer pressure, frankly. I mean, I think we’re maybe less susceptible to it. DUCKWORTH: I think he wants to say 21 — and by the way, you know, he’s not saying that, like, a miracle happens between 20 and 21 on that day. But again, he’s a practical guy. So he was like, you know, a society has to have laws and the laws have to have round numbers and you need that unambiguous separation. But the reason why he says 21 is very much informed by brain research. So, like, basically, the prefrontal cortex — you know, the part of your brain that sits right behind your forehead — it is the last to develop in evolution, and it’s the last to mature in your life. And so, for anybody who has young people in their lives, you should just know, like, this part of the brain continues maturing structurally and functionally well into your twenties. And there’s some disagreement about exactly how long, but part of Larry’s reasoning about age 21 is that that part of your brain that is in charge of impulse suppression, task switching, working memory, all that stuff, that is the part of your brain that you absolutely need to be had on, you know, high alert and in high functioning when you’re in an emotional hot decision-making context. And the other reason I know that Larry thinks about 21 is because when I told you about the sensation-seeking impulse — that is really strong throughout your teens, and it starts to fade.
